p: 87 % of staff wanted CPR if they were healthy, this dropped to 29 % if they were to have a chronic illness that affected them daily. Public figures were 62 % and 48.8 % respectively. People of African origin were less likely to want CPR if they had a chronic illness, compared to Caucasians. Those who went to university were more likely to want to discuss CPR with a doctor. Less than 3 % surveyed had a do not attempt resuscitation (DNAR) in place.
